gmx:name.gco:CharacterString: Feature catalog for Streamflow Gaging Stations of the United States, 2013

gmx:scope.gco:CharacterString: Stream-gaging stations; Stream measurements; Streamflow; Drainage

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: A gage used to measure the height (stage) and volume of flow at a point location on a water feature.
Internal feature number.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Esri

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Esri

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The representation of the entity in the data.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: A point is a 0-dimensional element. A point M is a point feature that can store a distance measurement (M) value along an associated line feature.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: ESRI

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: ESRI

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: A unique identifier for the feature.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: A code identifying the agency which reports data collected at the gage. Agency codes are fixed values assigned by the National Water Information System (NWIS).

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: U.S. Geological Survey

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Water Information System

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Water Information System

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The site number. Each site in the USGS data base has a unique 8- to 15-digit identification number. Site numbers are assigned by the USGS. The first two digits of the site number indicate the major drainage basin in which the site is located; the additional digits identify the site location within the stream network, and generally indicate the downstream order of the sites.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The name associated with the streamflow gaging station. The name is usually a brief phrase describing the location of the gage, including the name of the water feature the gage is on and landmarks nearby.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The Site Type Code of the gage, which describes the hydrologic setting of the site.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The gage is located on an estuary. An estuary is a partially enclosed coastal waterbody where tidal movement and stream flow mix fresh and salt water.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The gage is located at a facility where water is withdrawn or diverted from a stream or waterbody. Streamflow measurements at facility locations are expected to be strongly influenced by current or previous human activity; diversion sites include points such as the upstream end of a canal where it intersects a stream, the point where water is withdrawn from a reservoir, and the point where water is pumped from a water body for use elsewhere.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The gage is located on a lake, reservoir, or other impoundment. Lakes, reservoirs, and other impoundments are standing bodies of water, deeper than wetlands, including expanded portions of rivers, and may be natural or man-made.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The gage is located on a spring. A spring is a place where there is a natural flow of groundwater to the surface. Springs may be perennial, intermittent, or ephemeral.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The gage is located on a stream. A stream is a body of flowing water which follows a defined channel. The channel may be natural or may be partially artificial.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The gage is located on a canal. A canal is an artificial open waterway constructed to transport water, to irrigate or drain land, to connect two or more bodies of water, or to serve as a waterway for water craft; it is larger than a ditch.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The gage is located on a ditch. A ditch is an artificial waterway dug in the ground, constructed to transport water for drainage or irrigation. It may be lined or unlined, and is smaller than a canal.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The gage is on a tidal stream. The flow of a tidal stream is influenced by the tide, but the water chemistry is not normally affected.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The gage is located in a wetland. A wetland is a non-cultivated, vegetated area that is inundated or saturated for a significant part of the year. Wetlands may be natural or artificially created; they include swamps, marshes, bogs, and similar areas, and may be forested or unforested.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString:
A 14-digit, unique identifier for the reach where the gage is located. A reach is a continuous piece of surface water with similar hydrologic characteristics. A reach may be composed of a single feature, such as a lake or isolated stream, but reaches may also be composed of a number of contiguous features. The first eight digits of the code are the Watershed Boundary Dataset Hydrologic Unit Code (HUC), which identifies the subbasin in which the water feature is located. The next six digits are a randomly assigned, sequential number that is unique within the subbasin. Once assigned, a reach code is permanently associated with its reach.
The ReachCode links gages and other features to the 1:1,000,000-Scale Streams of the United States, National Hydrography Dataset, National Hydrography Dataset Plus Version 1, National Hydrography Dataset Plus Version 2, and other data sets that use reach codes. No gage is associated with more than one reach, however, there may be multiple gages on one reach.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The unique identifier of the stream segment where the gage is located. The Stream_ID is taken from the National Atlas Streams 1:1M map layer. No gage is associated with more than one Stream_ID, however, there may be multiple gages with the same Stream_ID.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The 2-letter Federal Information Processing Series (FIPS) code for the State or State equivalent in which the gage is located. If the gage falls in two States, both codes are listed, separated by a dash.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The 2-digit FIPS code for the State or State equivalent in which the gage is located. If the gage falls in two States, both codes are listed, separated by a dash.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The 2-digit Hydrologic Unit Code identifying the major river basin where the gage is located. Leading zeroes are not shown.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The 8-digit Hydrologic Unit Code identifying the subbasin where the gage is located.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The latitude of the gage as listed in the National Water Information System (NWIS).

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The longitude of the gage as listed in NWIS.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The latitude of the gage in this 1:1M National Atlas data. The value may be different from the NWIS latitude for one or more of the following reasons: the latitude was calculated using ArcGIS; the gage was moved in order to snap it to a stream in the National Atlas Streams 1:1M 2014 map layer; the stream the gage is associated with was generalized and moved for cartographic reasons; or the gage was moved to a new location based on the station name and a review of topographic maps and imagery.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The longitude of the gage in this 1:1M National Atlas data. The value may be different from the NWIS longitude for one or more of the following reasons: the longitude was calculated using ArcGIS; the gage was moved in order to snap it to a stream in the National Atlas Streams 1:1M 2014 map layer; the stream the gage is associated with was generalized and moved for cartographic reasons; or the gage was moved to a new location based on the station name and a review of topographic maps and imagery.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The source from which the gage information was obtained.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The gage was obtained from NHDPlus V1 Gages.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The gage was obtained from NHDPlus V2 Gages.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The gage was retrieved from NWISWeb.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The entity that determined the stream reach on which the gage is located. The reach and any gages associated with the reach may have been moved for cartographic purposes after the review.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The gage location was reviewed during the creation of the NHDPlus V1 Gages.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The gage location was reviewed during the creation of the NHDPlus V2 Gages.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The gage came from either the NHDPlus Version 1 or version 2 sources but the location was not reviewed during the creation of either of those data sets, nor during the creation of this data set.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The gage location was reviewed by geographers at the Texas Water Science Center. This is used for gages retrieved from NWIS Web. It was also used for gages from one of the two NHDPlus source data sets if the gage was moved to a new reach.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The measure represents a gage's location on a reach in the National Atlas Streams 1:1M 2014. Measures range from 0 to 100 and record the distance, as a percentage, from the downstream end of a reach. If a reach is composed of more than one stream segment, the measure is based on the length of the entire group of segments that comprise the reach. Measures are used in linear referencing.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The URL for the gage's page in NWIS Web. Detailed streamflow and other information for each gage is provided in NWIS Web.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States
